text: The 1998 Philadelphia Phillies season was the 116th season in the history of the franchise. ==Regular season== The first game of the Phillies season was an unforgettable opening day game at Shea Stadium against their division rival New York Mets. Both of them were involved in the longest scoreless opening day game in the National League and the longest one in the MLB since 1926 when the Washington Senators beat the Philadelphia Athletics 1-0 in 15 innings. However, the Phillies lost the game 1-0 in 14 innings when Mets backup catcher Alberto Castillo delivered a full-count, two-out, pinch-hit single to right with the bases loaded off Philadelphia closer Ricky Bottalico. This was the first regular season baseball game played in New York in March. ===Season standings=== ===Record vs. opponents=== ===Transactions=== *February 24, 1998: Midre Cummings was released by the Philadelphia Phillies. *June 2, 1998: Pat Burrell was drafted by the Philadelphia Phillies in the 1st round (1st pick) of the 1998 amateur draft.
